title: [Large-Scale] CEFR-Aligned Formative Assessment Strategies and Learner-Centered Instructional Design for Elementary English Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Instructional Design Theories and Elementary English Curriculum Comprehension
context.additional_context: CEFR-based learner-customized instructional design course for pre-service teachers and English education specialists, providing efficient learning experiences in a smartphone-based microlearning environment

learning_goals: Learners can design learner diagnostic tools by linking CEFR Basic User level descriptors with elementary English curricula.
Learners can propose three or more personalized formative assessment strategies based on learner profiles.
Learners can establish a self-assessment system using microlearning modules optimized for mobile environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
